intro: Rourea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf rourea, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large,革质 (leathery) leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by woody, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
